title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller about a woman's act of violence against her husband—and the therapist obsessed with uncovering her motive.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: A memoir about a woman who grows up in a strict and abusive household in rural Idaho but eventually escapes to learn about the wider world through education.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: Between life and death there is a library, and within it an infinite number of lives to choose from.

title: Dune
author: Frank Herbert
description: The epic science fiction masterpiece about politics, religion, and ecology on the desert planet Arrakis.

title: A Promised Land
author: Barack Obama
description: Barack Obama tells the story of his improbable odyssey from young man searching for identity to the leader of the free world.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A novel of warmth and humor despite dealing with serious issues of race and injustice in the American South.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A portrait of the Jazz Age in all of its decadence and excess, exploring themes of wealth and the American Dream.

title: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The first volume of Tolkien's epic saga that forever changed fantasy literature.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: Holden Caulfield narrates his experiences in New York City after being expelled from prep school.

title: The Four Agreements
author: Don Miguel Ruiz
description: A practical guide to personal freedom based on ancient Toltec wisdom.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A young girl in Nazi Germany finds solace by stealing books and sharing them with others.

title: Steve Jobs
author: Walter Isaacson
description: Based on more than forty interviews with Steve Jobs and hundreds more with family, friends, and colleagues.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son journey through a post-apocalyptic world of ash and desolation.

title: The Martian
author: Andy Weir
description: An astronaut becomes stranded on Mars and must find a way to survive.

title: Good to Great
author: Jim Collins
description: Why some companies make the leap from good to great while others don’t.

title: Man’s Search for Meaning
author: Viktor E. Frankl
description: Psychiatrist Viktor Frankl's memoir of surviving Nazi death camps and his reflections on life's purpose.

title: Thinking in Systems
author: Donella H. Meadows
description: A concise and crucial introduction to systems thinking and how to solve complex problems.

title: Brief Answers to the Big Questions
author: Stephen Hawking
description: Hawking's final thoughts on the universe, God, and the future of humanity.

title: Ikigai: The Japanese Secret to a Long and Happy Life
author: Héctor García, Francesc Miralles
description: The ancient Japanese philosophy for finding purpose and joy in everyday life.

title: The Little Prince
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry
description: A poetic tale that explores love, loneliness, and human nature through the eyes of a young prince.
